title: Improve Installer Script for Piped Execution
description:
The installer script (scripts/install.sh) currently relies on interactive user prompts (read -p) to ask about installing additional packages like Docker and Kubernetes. However, the recommended installation method in README.md uses a pipe to bash (curl ... | sudo bash), which breaks interactivity because stdin is consumed by the pipe.

Tasks:
1.  Analyze scripts/install.sh to identify all interactive prompts.
2.  Refactor the script to support non-interactive mode via environment variables or flags (e.g., INSTALL_DOCKER=true).
3.  Alternatively, update the installation method to download the script first, make it executable, and then run it interactively.
4.  Decide on the best approach (likely supporting env vars for pipe usage or changing the guide) and implement it.
close_reason: Implemented non-interactive install support and updated docs
